subject: Education
subcategory: Literacy and the Power of Reading
title: Empathy Through Fiction: Reading Other Minds
description: A 60-second lesson on Empathy Through Fiction: Reading Other Minds.

hook.text: People who read literary fiction score higher on empathy tests. Novels literally change how you understand other people.

buildup.text: Psychologist David Kidd found that reading literary fiction activates the brain's theory-of-mind network.

discovery.text: Unlike TV, novels force you to imagine characters' inner lives. You must build their feelings from words alone.

twist.text: The effect is specific to literary fiction. Genre fiction and nonfiction don't produce the same empathy boost.

climax.text: Reading novels is a workout for the social brain. Each character you imagine makes you better at reading real people.

punchline.text: Fiction is a flight simulator for empathy.

quiz.question: What type of reading most improves empathy according to research?
